This is all great feedback and what I was hoping to hear from people.

Eric J. Bowman wrote:
>> I think there are a huge amount of improvements we can make here.
>> For instance instead of defining URL patterns, URLs can be made more
>> opaque and instead the spec defines a set of resources, link
>> relationships, and interactions with those relationships.
>>
> 
> Which you seem to understand.  However, without having embarked on this
> work, you haven't proven that a RESTful end result is possible.  Clean
> slate time.  You'll either come up with a solution based on the REST
> design pattern, and prove Roy wrong, or you'll wind up where everyone
> else has, which is "Huh, Roy's right."  But you're nowhere near enough
> to boldly claim that problem solved, since you're defining URI patterns
> rather than describing what your resources are to begin with.
> 

FYI, I really wasn't ready to announce today.  Mark mentioned it as a 
bullet point in his keynote.  I mentioned it briefly in my JAX-RS talk. 
  Infoworld had an article today about REST-* and presented it *VERY 
POORLY*.  Mark felt compelled to respond.  Anne Manes got in the act, 
now we've snowballed into this...

Now I'm forced to play catchup...

Here's hoping I'm not voted off the island.

-- 
Bill Burke
JBoss, a division of Red Hat
http://bill.burkecentral.com
